# Tool Use Overview

Roo Code implements a sophisticated tool system that allows AI models to interact with your development environment in a controlled and secure manner. This document explains how tools work, when they're called, and how they're managed.

* * *

## Core Concepts [​](https://docs.roocode.com/advanced-usage/available-tools/tool-use-overview\#core-concepts "Direct link to Core Concepts")

### Tool Groups [​](https://docs.roocode.com/advanced-usage/available-tools/tool-use-overview\#tool-groups "Direct link to Tool Groups")

Tools are organized into logical groups based on their functionality:

| Category | Purpose | Tools | Common Use |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| **Read Group** | File system reading and exploration | [read\_file](https://docs.roocode.com/advanced-usage/available-tools/read-file), [list\_files](https://docs.roocode.com/advanced-usage/available-tools/list-files), [list\_code\_definition\_names](https://docs.roocode.com/advanced-usage/available-tools/list-code-definition-names) | Code exploration and analysis |
| **Search Group** | Pattern and semantic searching | [search\_files](https://docs.roocode.com/advanced-usage/available-tools/search-files), [codebase\_search](https://docs.roocode.com/advanced-usage/available-tools/codebase-search) | Finding code patterns and functionality |
| **Edit Group** | File system modifications | [apply\_diff](https://docs.roocode.com/advanced-usage/available-tools/apply-diff), [insert\_content](https://docs.roocode.com/advanced-usage/available-tools/insert-content), [search\_and\_replace](https://docs.roocode.com/advanced-usage/available-tools/search-and-replace), [write\_to\_file](https://docs.roocode.com/advanced-usage/available-tools/write-to-file) | Code changes and file manipulation |
| **Browser Group** | Web automation | [browser\_action](https://docs.roocode.com/advanced-usage/available-tools/browser-action) | Web testing and interaction |
| **Command Group** | System command execution | [execute\_command](https://docs.roocode.com/advanced-usage/available-tools/execute-command), [run\_slash\_command](https://docs.roocode.com/advanced-usage/available-tools/run-slash-command)\* | Running scripts, building projects, executing command templates |
| **MCP Group** | External tool integration | [use\_mcp\_tool](https://docs.roocode.com/advanced-usage/available-tools/use-mcp-tool), [access\_mcp\_resource](https://docs.roocode.com/advanced-usage/available-tools/access-mcp-resource) | Specialized functionality through external servers |
| **Workflow Group** | Mode and task management | [switch\_mode](https://docs.roocode.com/advanced-usage/available-tools/switch-mode), [new\_task](https://docs.roocode.com/advanced-usage/available-tools/new-task), [ask\_followup\_question](https://docs.roocode.com/advanced-usage/available-tools/ask-followup-question), [attempt\_completion](https://docs.roocode.com/advanced-usage/available-tools/attempt-completion) | Context switching and task organization |

\* _Experimental feature - requires explicit enablement in settings_

### Always Available Tools [​](https://docs.roocode.com/advanced-usage/available-tools/tool-use-overview\#always-available-tools "Direct link to Always Available Tools")

Certain tools are accessible regardless of the current mode:

- [ask\_followup\_question](https://docs.roocode.com/advanced-usage/available-tools/ask-followup-question): Gather additional information from users
- [attempt\_completion](https://docs.roocode.com/advanced-usage/available-tools/attempt-completion): Signal task completion
- [switch\_mode](https://docs.roocode.com/advanced-usage/available-tools/switch-mode): Change operational modes
- [new\_task](https://docs.roocode.com/advanced-usage/available-tools/new-task): Create subtasks

* * *

## Available Tools [​](https://docs.roocode.com/advanced-usage/available-tools/tool-use-overview\#available-tools "Direct link to Available Tools")

### Read Tools [​](https://docs.roocode.com/advanced-usage/available-tools/tool-use-overview\#read-tools "Direct link to Read Tools")

These tools help Roo understand your code and project:

- [read\_file](https://docs.roocode.com/advanced-usage/available-tools/read-file) \- Examines the contents of files
- [list\_files](https://docs.roocode.com/advanced-usage/available-tools/list-files) \- Maps your project's file structure
- [list\_code\_definition\_names](https://docs.roocode.com/advanced-usage/available-tools/list-code-definition-names) \- Creates a structural map of your code

### Search Tools [​](https://docs.roocode.com/advanced-usage/available-tools/tool-use-overview\#search-tools "Direct link to Search Tools")

These tools help Roo find patterns and functionality across your codebase:

- [search\_files](https://docs.roocode.com/advanced-usage/available-tools/search-files) \- Finds patterns across multiple files using regex
- [codebase\_search](https://docs.roocode.com/advanced-usage/available-tools/codebase-search) \- Performs semantic searches across your indexed codebase

### Edit Tools [​](https://docs.roocode.com/advanced-usage/available-tools/tool-use-overview\#edit-tools "Direct link to Edit Tools")

These tools help Roo make changes to your code:

- [apply\_diff](https://docs.roocode.com/advanced-usage/available-tools/apply-diff) \- Makes precise, surgical changes to your code
- [insert\_content](https://docs.roocode.com/advanced-usage/available-tools/insert-content) \- Adds new lines of content without modifying existing lines
- [search\_and\_replace](https://docs.roocode.com/advanced-usage/available-tools/search-and-replace) \- Finds and replaces text or regex patterns within a file
- [write\_to\_file](https://docs.roocode.com/advanced-usage/available-tools/write-to-file) \- Creates new files or completely rewrites existing ones

### Browser Tools [​](https://docs.roocode.com/advanced-usage/available-tools/tool-use-overview\#browser-tools "Direct link to Browser Tools")

These tools help Roo interact with web applications:

- [browser\_action](https://docs.roocode.com/advanced-usage/available-tools/browser-action) \- Automates browser interactions

### Command Tools [​](https://docs.roocode.com/advanced-usage/available-tools/tool-use-overview\#command-tools "Direct link to Command Tools")

These tools help Roo execute commands:

- [execute\_command](https://docs.roocode.com/advanced-usage/available-tools/execute-command) \- Runs system commands and programs
- [run\_slash\_command](https://docs.roocode.com/advanced-usage/available-tools/run-slash-command) \- Executes predefined slash commands for templated instructions _(Experimental - requires enablement)_

### MCP Tools [​](https://docs.roocode.com/advanced-usage/available-tools/tool-use-overview\#mcp-tools "Direct link to MCP Tools")

These tools help Roo connect with external services:

- [use\_mcp\_tool](https://docs.roocode.com/advanced-usage/available-tools/use-mcp-tool) \- Uses specialized external tools
- [access\_mcp\_resource](https://docs.roocode.com/advanced-usage/available-tools/access-mcp-resource) \- Accesses external data sources

### Workflow Tools [​](https://docs.roocode.com/advanced-usage/available-tools/tool-use-overview\#workflow-tools "Direct link to Workflow Tools")

These tools help manage the conversation and task flow:

- [ask\_followup\_question](https://docs.roocode.com/advanced-usage/available-tools/ask-followup-question) \- Gets additional information from you
- [attempt\_completion](https://docs.roocode.com/advanced-usage/available-tools/attempt-completion) \- Presents final results
- [switch\_mode](https://docs.roocode.com/advanced-usage/available-tools/switch-mode) \- Changes to a different mode for specialized tasks
- [new\_task](https://docs.roocode.com/advanced-usage/available-tools/new-task) \- Creates a new subtask

## Tool Calling Mechanism [​](https://docs.roocode.com/advanced-usage/available-tools/tool-use-overview\#tool-calling-mechanism "Direct link to Tool Calling Mechanism")

### Handling Complex Tasks [​](https://docs.roocode.com/advanced-usage/available-tools/tool-use-overview\#handling-complex-tasks "Direct link to Handling Complex Tasks")

For certain complex operations that require multiple steps, Roo doesn't just figure them out on the fly. Instead, it follows predefined, internal plans to ensure consistency and accuracy.

A prime example is creating a new MCP server, identified internally by `create_mcp_server`. **This identifier does not represent a tool you will see being called.** Rather, when you ask Roo to create a server, it triggers this known, multi-step workflow.

This specific workflow is initiated by Roo using its internal `fetch_instructions` tool (with the task `create_mcp_server`) to retrieve a detailed plan. This plan then guides Roo to make calls to several standard, documented tools in sequence, such as:

- [`execute_command`](https://docs.roocode.com/advanced-usage/available-tools/execute-command) for running setup scripts (e.g., `npx @modelcontextprotocol/create-server`).
- [`write_to_file`](https://docs.roocode.com/advanced-usage/available-tools/write-to-file) or [`apply_diff`](https://docs.roocode.com/advanced-usage/available-tools/apply-diff) for creating or modifying server code and configuration files.
- [`ask_followup_question`](https://docs.roocode.com/advanced-usage/available-tools/ask-followup-question) to gather necessary information like API keys from you.
- Other standard tools as needed for steps like determining file locations or updating configuration entries.

So, while the overall task (like `create_mcp_server`) is complex, it's ultimately accomplished by intelligently orchestrating the standard tools available in your environment. This approach allows Roo to reliably perform complex operations by leveraging the tools documented here.

### When Tools Are Called [​](https://docs.roocode.com/advanced-usage/available-tools/tool-use-overview\#when-tools-are-called "Direct link to When Tools Are Called")

Tools are invoked under specific conditions:

1. **Direct Task Requirements**
   - When specific actions are needed to complete a task as decided by the LLM
   - In response to user requests
   - During automated workflows
2. **Mode-Based Availability**
   - Different modes enable different tool sets
   - Mode switches can trigger tool availability changes
   - Some tools are restricted to specific modes
3. **Context-Dependent Calls**
   - Based on the current state of the workspace
   - In response to system events
   - During error handling and recovery

### Decision Process [​](https://docs.roocode.com/advanced-usage/available-tools/tool-use-overview\#decision-process "Direct link to Decision Process")

The system uses a multi-step process to determine tool availability:

1. **Mode Validation**





```codeBlockLines_e6Vv
isToolAllowedForMode(
       tool: string,
       modeSlug: string,
       customModes: ModeConfig[],
       toolRequirements?: Record<string, boolean>,
       toolParams?: Record<string, any>
)

```

2. **Requirement Checking**
   - System capability verification
   - Resource availability
   - Permission validation
3. **Parameter Validation**
   - Required parameter presence
   - Parameter type checking
   - Value validation

### Tool Call Processing [​](https://docs.roocode.com/advanced-usage/available-tools/tool-use-overview\#tool-call-processing "Direct link to Tool Call Processing")

1. **Initialization**
   - Tool name and parameters are validated
   - Mode compatibility is checked
   - Requirements are verified
2. **Execution**





```codeBlockLines_e6Vv
const toolCall = {
       type: "tool_call",
       name: chunk.name,
       arguments: chunk.input,
       callId: chunk.callId
}

```

3. **Result Handling**
   - Success/failure determination
   - Result formatting
   - Error handling

### Security and Permissions [​](https://docs.roocode.com/advanced-usage/available-tools/tool-use-overview\#security-and-permissions "Direct link to Security and Permissions")

1. **Access Control**
   - File system restrictions
   - Command execution limitations
   - Network access controls
2. **Validation Layers**
   - Tool-specific validation
   - Mode-based restrictions
   - System-level checks

## Mode Integration [​](https://docs.roocode.com/advanced-usage/available-tools/tool-use-overview\#mode-integration "Direct link to Mode Integration")

### Mode-Based Tool Access [​](https://docs.roocode.com/advanced-usage/available-tools/tool-use-overview\#mode-based-tool-access "Direct link to Mode-Based Tool Access")

Tools are made available based on the current mode:

- **Code Mode**: Full access to file system tools, code editing capabilities, command execution
- **Ask Mode**: Limited to reading tools, information gathering capabilities, no file system modifications
- **Architect Mode**: Design-focused tools, documentation capabilities, limited execution rights
- **Custom Modes**: Can be configured with specific tool access for specialized workflows

### Mode Switching [​](https://docs.roocode.com/advanced-usage/available-tools/tool-use-overview\#mode-switching "Direct link to Mode Switching")

1. **Process**
   - Current mode state preservation
   - Tool availability updates
   - Context switching
2. **Impact on Tools**
   - Tool set changes
   - Permission adjustments
   - Context preservation

* * *

## Best Practices [​](https://docs.roocode.com/advanced-usage/available-tools/tool-use-overview\#best-practices "Direct link to Best Practices")

### Tool Usage Guidelines [​](https://docs.roocode.com/advanced-usage/available-tools/tool-use-overview\#tool-usage-guidelines "Direct link to Tool Usage Guidelines")

1. **Efficiency**
   - Use the most specific tool for the task
   - Avoid redundant tool calls
   - Batch operations when possible
2. **Security**
   - Validate inputs before tool calls
   - Use minimum required permissions
   - Follow security best practices
3. **Error Handling**
   - Implement proper error checking
   - Provide meaningful error messages
   - Handle failures gracefully

### Common Patterns [​](https://docs.roocode.com/advanced-usage/available-tools/tool-use-overview\#common-patterns "Direct link to Common Patterns")

1. **Information Gathering**





```codeBlockLines_e6Vv
[ask_followup_question](/advanced-usage/available-tools/ask-followup-question) → [read_file](/advanced-usage/available-tools/read-file) → [codebase_search](/advanced-usage/available-tools/codebase-search)

```

2. **Code Modification**





```codeBlockLines_e6Vv
[read_file](/advanced-usage/available-tools/read-file) → [apply_diff](/advanced-usage/available-tools/apply-diff) → [attempt_completion](/advanced-usage/available-tools/attempt-completion)

```

3. **Task Management**





```codeBlockLines_e6Vv
[new_task](/advanced-usage/available-tools/new-task) → [switch_mode](/advanced-usage/available-tools/switch-mode) → [execute_command](/advanced-usage/available-tools/execute-command)

```

## Error Handling and Recovery [​](https://docs.roocode.com/advanced-usage/available-tools/tool-use-overview\#error-handling-and-recovery "Direct link to Error Handling and Recovery")

### Error Types [​](https://docs.roocode.com/advanced-usage/available-tools/tool-use-overview\#error-types "Direct link to Error Types")

1. **Tool-Specific Errors**
   - Parameter validation failures
   - Execution errors
   - Resource access issues
2. **System Errors**
   - Permission denied
   - Resource unavailable
   - Network failures
3. **Context Errors**
   - Invalid mode for tool
   - Missing requirements
   - State inconsistencies

### Recovery Strategies [​](https://docs.roocode.com/advanced-usage/available-tools/tool-use-overview\#recovery-strategies "Direct link to Recovery Strategies")

1. **Automatic Recovery**
   - Retry mechanisms
   - Fallback options
   - State restoration
2. **User Intervention**
   - Error notifications
   - Recovery suggestions
   - Manual intervention options
